text: The finding that the literature on how decisions about what research is funded and conducted during disease epidemics almost exclusively focused on the ethical implications ( and did not question the potential power imbalances with regard to who identified the research issue / question and who led the research for example ) , was surprising , since this was a key theme in the broad politics of epidemics literature . This could , in part , be a reflection of the limitations of the search engines and strategy used in the study which excluded publications , which were deemed biomedical . Conversely , it may be a reflection of limited support for critical research and related publications .
